body_html:
Why do you run (20, 16K)? I thought 16K labels with dense tensors of size 512 is more realistic?

I just don't have the resources to run any bigger.

When benchmarking TF one always has to first run the benchmark a few hundred steps without measuring, just to warm-up the graph and stuff. Are you doing that?

This is the benchmark suite I wrote https://github.com/AndreasMadsen/tensorflow-sparsemax-benchmark. Do you have an example of how to ideally benchmark a TF function, I think that would be more productive.

body:
> Why do you run (20, 16K)? I thought 16K labels with dense tensors of size 512 is more realistic?

I just don't have the resources to run any bigger.

> When benchmarking TF one always has to first run the benchmark a few hundred steps without measuring, just to warm-up the graph and stuff. Are you doing that?

This is the benchmark suite I wrote https://github.com/AndreasMadsen/tensorflow-sparsemax-benchmark. Do you have an example of how to ideally benchmark a TF function, I think that would be more productive.
